revised_title: Tensor Identities and Wave-Tensor Calculus in Physics
tldr: The authors explore tensor identities and wave-tensor calculus, using quaternion methods to study Eddington's tensor identities in both single and double frames. They calculate the gyromagnetic ratio of the electron and deduce a set of equations that include field equations of general relativity. The authors also discuss discrepancies with Eddington's results and provide reasons for preferring their equations.
